page.title: 15TRANSPORT - NORTH TAWTON
page.content: {ROADS }North Tawton is only 5 miles from the{A30}dual carriageway at Whiddon Down which in turn joins the national motorway network in Exeter. A recent major road improvement involving the road from Winkleigh to North Tawton and the raising of the railway bridge south of De Bathe Cross on this road now means that large vehicles travelling from North Devon can gain access to the M5 without having to pass through Crediton and Exeter. {RAILWAYS }The railway line which passes through North Tawton is mainly used for carrying stone from Meldon Quarry near Okehampton.It is also used occasionally for carrying troops to okehampton Camp.Recently a trial passenger service has been introduced between Okehampton and Exeter. {AIR}Nil:-Exeter nearest airport.
